issues.issue: Fine interior hatching and very thin line clusters create a lot of tiny enclosed regions that could be difficult for young children to color.

issues.suggestion: Close very small gaps on the cracked edges and slightly thicken or simplify tiny background elements to ensure clean fill boundaries.

issues.issue: Some very fine background details (small shells and tiny accents) may not reproduce well at smaller print sizes.
issues.suggestion: Either enlarge those background elements slightly or remove some of the smallest marks to maintain clarity when printed at typical coloring-book dimensions.
